page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: This area has excellent farming land especially on the valley floor.On the hills there is good grazing land for sheep,while lower down the soil is fertile and easy to work.Many crops can be grown,the most popular being barley.Much of this is sown in the autumn.Hay and silage is also grown as fodder. Most of the farms are mixed,that is they rear cattle and sheep and also grow crops.Some farms have large dairy herds of friesian cows.They send the milk to the creamery at nearby Llandyrnog where it is made into cheese. There is one large egg producing farm,and stables for rearing horses. Markets are held weekly in Ruthin, Denbigh and other nearby towns and these are widely used by the local farmers.
